Description: Body and rim sherd of Ionian pottery plate; fine orange micacious clay; exterior: reserved with set of two orange-fired bands on lower body and three beneath rim; edge of rim glazed; interior slipped; stopt maeander band on top of lip; at outside of floor, between bands with added red and white lines, frieze of loose alternating palmettes; to the centre, frieze of triple strokes alternating with squares and crosses.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1179)
